verses.roman:
varaṁ vilokyābhimataṁ samāgataṁ
narendra-kanyā cakame ramā-patim
bhūyād ayaṁ me patir āśiṣo 'nalaḥ
karotu satyā yadi me dhṛto vrataḥ

synonyms: varam—suitor; vilokya—seeing; abhimatam—agreeable; samāgatam—arrived; narendra—of the King; kanyā—the daughter; cakame—desired; ramā—of the goddess of fortune; patim—the husband; bhūyāt—may become; ayam—He; me—my; patiḥ—husband; āśiṣaḥ—hopes; analaḥ—the fire; karotu—may it make; satyāḥ—true; yadi—if; me—by me; dhṛtaḥ—sustained; vrataḥ—my vows.
translation: When the King's daughter saw that most agreeable suitor arrive, she immediately desired to have Him, the Lord of Goddess Rāma. She prayed, "May He become my husband. If I have kept my vows, may the sacred fire bring about the fulfillment of my hopes.
